describe: Slovakia, a landlocked country in Central Europe, is known for its dramatic natural landscapes, medieval history, and rich cultural heritage. It boasts a diverse range of attractions from the High Tatras mountains to historic castles and vibrant cities.

cities.name: 游깲 Bratislava
cities.geographical_location: Located in the southwestern part of Slovakia, along the Danube River, near the borders with Austria and Hungary.
cities.climate: Bratislava has a continental climate with hot summers and cold, humid winters.
cities.famous_cuisine: Bryndzov칠 halu코ky (potato dumplings with sheep cheese), Kapustnica (sauerkraut soup).

cities.name: 游깭 Ko코ice
cities.geographical_location: Situated in eastern Slovakia, near the border with Hungary.
cities.climate: Ko코ice experiences a continental climate with warm summers and cold winters.

cities.name: 游끷 Poprad
cities.geographical_location: Located in northern Slovakia, at the foot of the High Tatras mountains.
cities.climate: Poprad has a cool mountain climate with cold winters and mild summers.
cities.famous_cuisine: Tatarsk치 om치캜ka (Tartar sauce), Spi코sk칠 p치rky (Spi코 sausages).
